isort.option:
Type: IsortOptions/null
Status: DEPRECATED

Available Sub-options:
  - case-sensitive: Sort imports taking into account case sensitivity.
  - classes: An override list of tokens to always recognize as a Class for
  - combine-as-imports: Combines as imports on the same line. See isort's [`combine-as-imports`](https://pycqa.github.io/isort/docs/configuration/options.html#combine-as-imports)
  - constants: An override list of tokens to always recognize as a CONSTANT
  - default-section: Define a default section for any imports that don't fit into the specified [`section-order`](#lint_isort_section-order).
  - detect-same-package: Whether to automatically mark imports from within the same package as first-party.
  - extra-standard-library: A list of modules to consider standard-library, in addition to those
  - force-single-line: Forces all from imports to appear on their own line.
  - force-sort-within-sections: Don't sort straight-style imports (like `import sys`) before from-style
  - force-to-top: Force specific imports to the top of their appropriate section.
  - force-wrap-aliases: Force `import from` statements with multiple members and at least one
  - forced-separate: A list of modules to separate into auxiliary block(s) of imports,
  - from-first: Whether to place `import from` imports before straight imports when sorting.
  - known-first-party: A list of modules to consider first-party, regardless of whether they
  - known-local-folder: A list of modules to consider being a local folder.
  - known-third-party: A list of modules to consider third-party, regardless of whether they
  - length-sort: Sort imports by their string length, such that shorter imports appear
  - length-sort-straight: Sort straight imports by their string length. Similar to [`length-sort`](#lint_isort_length-sort),
  - lines-after-imports: The number of blank lines to place after imports.
  - lines-between-types: The number of lines to place between "direct" and `import from` imports.
  - no-lines-before: A list of sections that should _not_ be delineated from the previous
  - no-sections: Put all imports into the same section bucket.
  - order-by-type: Order imports by type, which is determined by case, in addition to
  - relative-imports-order: Whether to place "closer" imports (fewer `.` characters, most local)
  - required-imports: Add the specified import line to all files.
  - section-order: Override in which order the sections should be output. Can be used to move custom sections.
  - sections: A list of mappings from section names to modules.
  - single-line-exclusions: One or more modules to exclude from the single line rule.
  - split-on-trailing-comma: If a comma is placed after the last member in a multi-line import, then
  - variables: An override list of tokens to always recognize as a var
